reviews.text: Modern, comfortable and affordable hotel in the center of Graz. Within walking distance from most attractions including the lovely Aiola restaurant on the castle mountain. Spacious rooms with free WiFi. Very good breakfast and good service.
reviews.title: Great central hotel in Graz

This was my second stay at this hotel. We unfortunatly did not get the upgraded room we reserved and had preciously, but they did have a large convention in the hotel and that was their reason for giving our room away. Nice modern public areas, perfct free wi-fi, nice breakfast. Hallways to rooms, not so nice - smelled very old and dingy and random open doors leading to housekeeping areas that seemed somewhat unsafe. Otherwise, great priced hotel with view of the Muir River and close to nice restraunts and historic sights.
reviews.title: Great Location, Walking Distance to City Center and Historic Sights

reviews.text: Nicely renewed hotel struggling with the old architecture how to make use of corridors and levels. Basic rooms and bathrooms, high ceilings, but nice personal, great breakfast and free internet which works. Close to Graz castle and city centre.
reviews.title: Efficient

reviews.text: Renovated circa 2008, this hotel has modern, comfortable rooms, though slightly small. Try to get a room overlooking the river. Breakfast is a very good buffet - not the largest spread, but all good - with many breads and sliced meats, as well as eggs, and many other choices.
reviews.title: Great Location in historic city center

reviews.text: The Weitzer is just across the river from the old town center, and it's traditional and historic architecture. Graz is large enough, and historic enough, to have things to see and do, but not so big as to lose it's charm.
reviews.title: Good hotel close to city centre

reviews.text: Very close to the city centre and to tram system. Very clean. Rooms a bit small and bare. You can also reach it quickly from the train station as it is just 3 stops away. In my opinion it is a bit expensive for what it offers.
reviews.title: At the river Mur, close to the Center of Graz

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location, perfect overlooking the river Muir, No traffic noise, very central. Room, large, clean, comfortable bed, great shower. Air conditioning very welcome as the temperatures soared that week. Breakfast, plenty of choice and variety. Staff the most important element, friendly, helpful, attentive. We spent 8 perfect days in the lovely city and surrounding area with a great base to return to. What better way to spend your 55th wedding anniversary
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Great location
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for one night, the receptionist made us feel so at home from the moment we arrived. Our two rooms were not available as we had arrived early, she took the luggage away and told us to go and enjoy the sights of the old city which was so central from the hotel and just across the river. After a very pleasant afternoon we arrived back at our room to find our luggage had been delivered each to the separate rooms which wee next to each other as we requested. Well done. We unfortunately had to leave very early so I cannot comment on the breakfast, but we would really go back to this hotel, the rooms were sufficient and the showers although a but small were just what we needed.

First of all: the location of the hotel is great! Directly at the river and very close to the center. The lobby is beautiful, in a very special style. I stayed in a room of the type „casual“. Really nice, big bed with good sleeping comfort and a big couch. The room was minimalistic but stylish and clean.
reviews.title: Great Staff!

reviews.text: I also enjoyed the offer to rent bicycles very easily and directly at the hotel, so i could discover the city by bike.
reviews.title: Great view from top floor

reviews.text: A special bonus point earns the staff! They were really friendly, always with a smile on their lips. The breakfast is also excellent. Really nothing I would add there....
